bug.summary: docs: hello world yaml file need to be updated
bug.description:
Describe the bug <denchmark-link:https://docs.jina.ai/chapters/helloworld/index.html>https://docs.jina.ai/chapters/helloworld/index.html</denchmark-link>
I'm running the Hello World example. Here are the steps:
type the code to start up the docker image: docker run -v "$(pwd)/j:/j" jinaai/jina:devel hello-world --workdir /j --logserver && open j/hello-world.html make an empty folder: /software/tests, and make a file named index.yaml, here is the context:
<denchmark-code>!Flow pods: chunk_seg: uses: helloworld.crafter.yml replicas: $REPLICAS read_only: true doc_idx: uses: helloworld.indexer.doc.yml encode: uses: helloworld.encoder.yml needs: chunk_seg replicas: $REPLICAS chunk_idx: uses: helloworld.indexer.chunk.yml replicas: $SHARDS separated_workspace: true join_all: uses: _merge needs: [doc_idx, chunk_idx] read_only: true </denchmark-code>
type python in the terminal, and input the python api:
<denchmark-code>from jina.flow import Flow
f = Flow.load_config('index.yml')
with f: f.index(input_fn) </denchmark-code>
Then I got error messages below: chunk_seg@23736[C]:unknown exception: ImageNotFound(HTTPError('404 Client Error: Not Found for url: http+docker://localhost/v1.39/images/create?fromImage=helloworld.crafter.yml')) Describe how you solve it
switch the work space from /software/tests to /software/jina make a new file named helloworld.flow.index.yml:
<denchmark-code>!Flow with: logserver: $WITH_LOGSERVER compress_hwm: 1024 pods: encode: uses: $RESOURCE_DIR/helloworld.encoder.yml parallel: $PARALLEL index: uses: $RESOURCE_DIR/helloworld.indexer.yml shards: $SHARDS separated_workspace: true </denchmark-code>
rerun the python api
